SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.fosstrak.reader.rprm.core.msg.command
Class TextCommandParserHelper

java.lang.Object
  org.fosstrak.reader.rprm.core.msg.command.TextCommandParserHelper

public class TextCommandParserHelper
extends java.lang.Object

TextCommandParserHelper provides general utilities for the text parser. In particular it generates the tree of the intermediate representation (IR).

How parameters are parsed:
During the parsing process the TextCommandParser puts parameters to the parameter queue (FIFO). While creating the IR the parameters are again read from the parameter queue. To be able to handle cases where there are nested parameter lists the parser distincts different parsing states which can be modified by pushState(), popState() and topState(). If the parser is in the state STATE_LIST_PARAMETER (parsing a parameter list) it works on a so called working list. Parameters are added to the working list and the whole working list is added to the local parameter queue. In this way it's possible to handle recursive (nested) lists of parameters.

Author:
Andreas Fürer, ETH Zurich Switzerland, Winter 2005/06
See Also:
TextCommandParser

readValueParameter

public ValueParameter readValueParameter()
                                  throws TextCommandParserException
Gets the head of the parameter queue and removes the element.

Returns:
the first parameter in the queue as a ValueParameter.
Throws:
TextCommandParserException - if no more parameters are available or the parameter is not of type ValueParameter
